inclusion.criterion: histologically-proven, recurrent supratentorial grade IV glioblastoma (or grade III IDH-wildtype anaplastic astrocytoma)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: unsafe complete surgical resection due to location, shape, or size of the tumor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: standard of care therapy with chemoradiation with temozolomide followed by adjuvant chemotherapy with temozolomide
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: lesion suitable for LITT is single, enhancing, supratentorial, at least 2 cm from inner table of skull over the hemispheric convexity, and > 1 cm, but < 4 cm in cross-sectional dimension
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: stable cardiovascular, neurovascular and neurological status, and be considered surgical candidates
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: not receiving concurrent anti-tumor treatment and have recovered from toxicity of prior treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: not previously undergone an intracranial LITT procedure
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: prior treatment of glioblastoma with stereotactic radiosurgery, brachytherapy, or carmustine-impregnated wafers (Gliadel)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine complicated by severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain.
